title: Bug 28974 - Compiler error when introducing a 'final' field
description: This bug report highlights a compilation error that occurs when introducing a 'final' field within an aspect.
OB: The observed behavior is that the provided aspect fails to compile with version 1.1b2 of the software. The specific compilation error message is as follows: '$ ajc com/ibm/amc/.java com/ibm/amc/ejb/.javad:/eclipse/runtimeworkspaceajsamples/Mock EJBs/com/ibm/amc/DemoBeanEJB.java:1: Cannot assign a value to the final field com.ibm.amc.DemoBean.ajc$interField$comibmamc$verbose!!'
EB: The expected behavior is that introducing a 'final' field within an aspect should be allowed without causing a compilation error.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Attempt to compile the provided aspect using version 1.1b2 of the software.
2. Observe the compilation error message as mentioned in the observed behavior.
